list_definition.definition: a piece of metal with a design, inscription etc stamped on it, given as a reward for bravery, long service, excellence etc, or made to celebrate a special occasion

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He won a medal in the War.

list_ex_of_english: Available statistics do not show how many of these officers and other ranks are entitled to medals and campaign stars.
There has, however, been little delay in issuing medals once an individual's entitlement has been confirmed.
Officers are eligible to receive crosses or equivalent decorations but non-commissioned ranks are eligible only for medals.
We have been carrying out a comprehensive review of all the monetary benefits that are payable in connection with the award of various medals.
As to the precedent of the last war, these medals were issued only to those who served overseas, with one exception.
Many of them wear three or four medals on their chests in honour of the service that they have given the nation.
I do not think that it is appropriate to draw a comparison between the two medals.
Unlike the first world war, when medals were automatically issued to enlisted service men, following world war two, all ranks had to apply.
